seo.title: The History of Positano (concise)
seo.description: A short history of Positano: traders, cliffs, and tourism.

intro: Understand Positano's past—from maritime roots to Hollywood discovery—so your walks have historical context.

sections.title: Origins & trade
body: Positano began as a Roman seaside villa hub; later, medieval traders exported wool and imported spices via Amalfi's fleet.
The watchtowers along the coast warned of Saracen raids—many survive as viewpoints today.

sections.title: 20th-century transformation
body: After World War II, artists and writers such as Steinbeck publicised Positano's charm, shifting the economy toward tourism.
Improved roads in the 1950s connected Positano to the rest of Italy, ushering in boutique hotels and visitors.

sections.title: Modern day
body: Tourism now anchors the town, with efforts to balance preservation and visitor numbers through ferry quotas and pedestrian zones.
Local artisans still craft sandals and ceramics, keeping heritage trades alive alongside hospitality.

tips: Visit the Roman Villa museum under Santa Maria Assunta to see mosaics unearthed in 1987.
Look for information plaques along Via dei Mulini that highlight key historic buildings.

faqs.q: Where can I learn more on site?
a: The MAR Positano museum combines archaeology and multimedia displays, ideal for rainy days.

faqs.q: Why are there so many stairs?
a: The town was built vertically to adapt to cliffs; staircases replaced streets for quick movement between terraces.
